<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Cautionary Note About Forward-Looking Statements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	This Annual Report on Form 10-K includes &#147;forward-looking&#148; statements within the meaning of federal securities laws.
	Forward-looking statements may be identified by the fact that they do not relate strictly to historical or current facts. They often include words such as &#147;may,&#148; &#147;will,&#148; &#147;can,&#148; &#147;should,&#148; &#147;would,&#148;
	&#147;could,&#148; &#147;anticipate,&#148; &#147;expect,&#148; &#147;plan,&#148; &#147;seek,&#148; &#147;believe,&#148; &#147;predict,&#148; &#147;estimate,&#148; &#147;potential,&#148; &#147;project,&#148; &#147;assume,&#148; &#147;guide,&#148;
	&#147;target,&#148; &#147;forecast,&#148; &#147;intend,&#148; &#147;strategy,&#148; &#147;is confident that,&#148; &#147;future,&#148; &#147;opportunity,&#148; and similar expressions.&nbsp;Forward-looking statements are based on current
	expectations and assumptions that are subject to risks and uncertainties which may cause actual results to differ materially from the forward-looking statements. A detailed discussion of risks and uncertainties that could cause actual results and
	events to differ materially from such forward-looking statements is included in the section titled &#147;Risk Factors&#148; (refer to Part I, Item&nbsp;1A of this report). Readers of this report are cautioned not to place undue reliance on these
	forward-looking statements. While we believe the assumptions on which the forward-looking statements are based are reasonable, there can be no assurance that these forward-looking statements will prove to be accurate. We expressly disclaim any
	obligation to update or revise any forward-looking statements, whether as a result of new information, future events or otherwise.&nbsp;You are advised, however, to consult any further disclosures we make on related subjects in our Quarterly Reports
	on Form 10-Q and Current Reports on Form 8-K.
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<A HREF="#D112646D10K_HTM_TX112646_19">
	Executive Compensation
</A>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">

	&nbsp;

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="1">
	ZIMMER BIOMET HOLDINGS, INC.
</FONT>
</TD>

	&nbsp;&nbsp;

	&nbsp;

<EFX_PART_I>
<A NAME="FIS_PART_I"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="3">
<A NAME="D112646D10K_HTM_TX112646_1">
</A>
	PART I
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:5PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_BUSINESS>
<A NAME="FIS_BUSINESS"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D112646D10K_HTM_TX112646_2">
</A>
	Item 1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Business
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Overview
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Zimmer Biomet is a global leader in
	musculoskeletal healthcare. We design, manufacture and market orthopaedic reconstructive products; sports medicine, biologics, extremities and trauma products; spine, bone healing, craniomaxillofacial and thoracic products; dental implants; and
	related surgical products. We collaborate with healthcare professionals around the globe to advance the pace of innovation. Our products and solutions help treat patients suffering from disorders of, or injuries to, bones, joints or supporting soft
	tissues. Together with healthcare professionals, we help millions of people live better lives. In this report, &#147;Zimmer Biomet,&#148; &#147;we,&#148; &#147;us,&#148; &#147;our,&#148; &#147;the Company&#148; and similar words refer collectively
	to Zimmer Biomet Holdings, Inc. and its subsidiaries. &#147;Zimmer Biomet Holdings&#148; refers to the parent company only.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Zimmer Biomet Holdings was incorporated in Delaware in 2001.&nbsp;Our history dates to 1927, when Zimmer Manufacturing Company, a
	predecessor, was founded in Warsaw, Indiana.&nbsp;On August 6, 2001, we were spun off from our former parent and became an independent public company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On June 24, 2015 (the &#147;Closing Date&#148;), we acquired LVB Acquisition, Inc. (&#147;LVB&#148;), the parent company of Biomet, Inc. (&#147;Biomet&#148;), and LVB and Biomet became our wholly-owned
	subsidiaries (sometimes hereinafter referred to as the &#147;Biomet merger&#148; or the &#147;merger&#148;). In connection with the merger, we changed our name from Zimmer Holdings, Inc. to Zimmer Biomet Holdings, Inc. The Biomet merger is expected
	to be a transformational event for us and have significant effects on all aspects of our business.&nbsp;Throughout 2015 and entering 2016, a key focus of ours has been, and will continue to be, the successful integration of Biomet.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#147;Zimmer&#148; used alone refers to the business or information of us and our subsidiaries on a stand-alone basis without inclusion of
	the business or information of LVB or any of its subsidiaries.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Customers, Sales and Marketing
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our primary customers include
	orthopaedic surgeons, neurosurgeons, oral surgeons, and other specialists, dentists, hospitals, stocking distributors, healthcare dealers and, in their capacity as agents, healthcare purchasing organizations or buying groups.&nbsp;These customers
	range from large multinational enterprises to independent clinicians and dentists.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We have operations throughout the world. We
	manage our operations through three major geographic operating segments and four product category operating segments. Our three major geographic operating segments are the Americas, which is comprised principally of the U.S. and includes other
	North, Central and South American markets; EMEA, which is comprised principally of Europe and includes the Middle East and African markets; and Asia Pacific, which is comprised primarily of Japan and includes other Asian and Pacific
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	markets. Our four product category operating segments, which are individually not as significant as our geographic operating segments, are as follows: 1) Americas Spine; 2) Bone Healing; 3)
	Craniomaxillofacial and Thoracic (&#147;CMF&#148;); and 4) Dental.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We market and sell products through three principal
	channels:&nbsp;1) direct to healthcare institutions, such as hospitals, referred to as direct channel accounts; 2) through stocking distributors and healthcare dealers; and 3) directly to dental practices and dental laboratories.&nbsp;With direct
	channel accounts, inventory is generally consigned to sales agents or customers.&nbsp;With sales to stocking distributors, healthcare dealers, dental practices and dental laboratories, title to product passes upon shipment or upon implantation of
	the product.&nbsp;Direct channel accounts represented approximately 80 percent of our net sales in 2015.&nbsp;No individual direct channel account, stocking distributor, healthcare dealer, dental practice or dental laboratory accounted for more than
	1&nbsp;percent of our net sales for 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We stock inventory in our warehouse facilities and retain title to consigned
	inventory in sufficient quantities so that products are available when needed for surgical procedures.&nbsp;Safety stock levels are determined based on a number of factors, including demand, manufacturing lead times and quantities required to
	maintain service levels.&nbsp;We also carry trade accounts receivable balances based on credit terms that are generally consistent with local market practices.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We utilize a network of sales associates, sales managers and support personnel, some of whom are employed or contracted by independent distributors and sales agencies.&nbsp;We invest a significant amount
	of time and expense in training sales associates in how to use specific products and how to best inform surgeons of product features and uses.&nbsp;Sales force representatives must have strong technical selling skills and medical education to
	provide technical support for surgeons.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In response to the different healthcare systems throughout the world, our sales and
	marketing strategies and organizational structures differ by region.&nbsp;We utilize a global approach to sales force training, marketing and medical education to provide consistent, high quality service. Additionally, we keep current with key
	surgical developments and other issues related to orthopaedic surgeons, neurosurgeons, other specialists, dentists and oral surgeons and the medical procedures they perform.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Due to the Biomet merger, we changed our senior management organizational structure which has resulted in a change to our operating segments.&nbsp;We now allocate resources to achieve our operating profit
	goals through seven operating segments.&nbsp;Our operating segments are comprised of both geographic and product category business units.&nbsp;We are organized through a combination of geographic and product category operating segments for various
	reasons, including the distribution channels through which products are sold.&nbsp;Our product category operating segments generally have distribution channels focused specifically on those product
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; HEIGHT:0PX; FONT-SIZE:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
	3
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage4"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D112646D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="47%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="1">
	ZIMMER BIOMET HOLDINGS, INC.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="1">
	2015 FORM 10-K ANNUAL REPORT
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	categories, whereas our geographic operating segments have distribution channels that sell multiple product categories.&nbsp;The following is a summary of our seven operating segments.&nbsp;See
	Note 18 to the consolidated financial statements for more information regarding our segments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Americas.
</I>
	The Americas
	geographic operating segment is our largest operating segment.&nbsp;The U.S. accounts for 94 percent of net sales in this region.&nbsp;The U.S. sales force consists of a combination of employees and independent sales agents, most of whom sell
	products exclusively for Zimmer Biomet.&nbsp;The sales force in the U.S. receives a commission on product sales and is responsible for many operating decisions and costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In this region, we contract with group purchasing organizations and managed care accounts and have promoted unit growth by offering volume discounts to customer healthcare institutions within a specified
	group.&nbsp;Generally, we are designated as one of several preferred purchasing sources for specified products, although members are not obligated to purchase our products.&nbsp;Contracts with group purchasing organizations generally have a term of
	three years, with extensions as warranted.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In the Americas, we monitor and rank independent sales agents and our direct sales
	force across a range of performance metrics, including the achievement of sales targets and maintenance of efficient levels of working capital.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	EMEA.
</I>
	&nbsp;The EMEA geographic operating segment is our second largest operating segment.&nbsp;France, Germany, Italy, Spain and the United Kingdom collectively account for 62&nbsp;percent of net
	sales in the region.&nbsp;This segment also includes other key markets, including Switzerland, Benelux, Nordic, Central and Eastern Europe, the Middle East and Africa.&nbsp;Our sales force in this segment is comprised of direct sales associates,
	commissioned agents, independent distributors and sales support personnel. We emphasize the advantages of our clinically proven, established designs and innovative solutions and new and enhanced materials and surfaces.&nbsp;In most European
	countries, healthcare is sponsored by the government and therefore government budgets impact healthcare spending, which can affect our sales in this segment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Asia Pacific.
</I>
	The Asia Pacific geographic operating segment includes key markets such as Japan, Australia, New Zealand, Korea, China, Taiwan, India, Thailand, Singapore, Hong Kong and Malaysia.
	Japan is the largest market within this segment, accounting for 40 percent of the region&#146;s sales. In Japan and most countries in the Asia Pacific region, we maintain a network of dealers, who act as order agents on behalf of hospitals in the
	region, and sales associates, who build and maintain relationships with orthopaedic surgeons and neurosurgeons in their markets. The knowledge and skills of these sales associates play a critical role in providing service, product information and
	support to surgeons. We have a research and development center in Beijing, China, which focuses on products and technologies designed to meet the unique needs of Asian patients and their healthcare providers.
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Americas Spine.
</I>
	&nbsp;The Americas Spine product category operating segment is
	comprised of our spine products division in the Americas, primarily in the U.S. market, but also in other North, Central and South American markets.&nbsp;The market dynamics of the Americas Spine business are similar to those described in the
	Americas geographic operating segment. However, the Americas Spine business maintains a separate sales force of employees and independent sales agents.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Bone Healing
</I>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our Bone Healing product category operating segment only sells to U.S. customers. In this product category, we market our products to doctors who prescribe them
	for use by patients. The products are mostly provided directly by Zimmer Biomet to patients and are paid for through patients&#146; insurance or by patients themselves. Products are also sold through wholesale channels on a limited basis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	CMF
</I>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our CMF product category operating segment competes across the world through a combination
	of direct and independent sales agents.&nbsp;The U.S. sales force consists of a combination of employees and independent sales agents.&nbsp;Internationally, our primary customers are independent stocking distributors who market our products to their
	customers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Dental
</I>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our Dental product category operating segment competes across the
	world.&nbsp;Our sales force is primarily composed of employees who market our products to customers.&nbsp;We sell directly to dental practices or dental laboratories, or to independent stocking distributors depending on the market.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Seasonality
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our business is seasonal in nature to some extent, as many of our products are used in elective procedures, which typically decline during
	the summer months and can increase at the end of the year once annual deductibles have been met on health insurance plans.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Distribution
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We distribute our
	products both through large, centralized warehouses and through smaller, market specific facilities, depending on the needs of the market.&nbsp;We maintain large, centralized warehouses in the U.S. and Europe to be able to efficiently distribute our
	products to customers in those regions.&nbsp;In addition to these centralized warehouses, we maintain smaller distribution facilities within each of the countries where we have a direct sales presence.&nbsp;In many locations, our inventory is
	consigned to the healthcare institution.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We generally ship our orders via expedited courier.&nbsp;We do not consider our
	backlog of firm orders to be material to an understanding of our business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Products
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our products include orthopaedic
	reconstructive products; sports medicine, biologics, extremities and trauma products; spine, bone healing and CMF products; dental implants; and related surgical products.
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; HEIGHT:0PX; FONT-SIZE:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
	4
</FONT>
</P>

<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">

	ZIMMER BIOMET HOLDINGS, INC.
</FONT>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">

	&nbsp;&nbsp;

<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="1">
	2015 FORM 10-K ANNUAL REPORT
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
<B>
	KNEES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Total knee replacement surgeries typically include a femoral component, a patella (knee cap), a tibial tray and an articular surface (placed on the tibial tray).&nbsp;Knee replacement surgeries include
	first-time, or primary, joint replacement procedures and revision procedures for the replacement, repair or enhancement of an implant or component from a previous procedure.&nbsp;There are also procedures for partial reconstruction of the knee,
	which treat limited knee degeneration and involve the replacement of only one side, or compartment, of the knee with a unicompartmental knee prosthesis.&nbsp;Our knee portfolio also includes early intervention and joint preservation products, which
	seek to preserve the joint by repairing or regenerating damaged tissues and by treating osteoarthritis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our significant knee
	brands include the following:
</FONT>
</P>

</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
<B>
	HIPS
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Total hip replacement
	surgeries replace both the head of the femur and the socket portion of the pelvis (acetabulum) of the natural hip.&nbsp;Hip procedures include first-time, or primary, joint replacement as well as revision procedures.&nbsp;Hip implant procedures
	involve the use of bone cement to attach or affix the prosthetic components to the surrounding bone, or are press-fit into bone, which means that they have a surface that bone affixes to through either ongrowth or ingrowth technologies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our significant hip brands include the following:
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	Zimmer

	Taper Hip Prosthesis
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
<B>
	S.E.T.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our S.E.T. product category includes surgical, sports medicine, biologics, foot and ankle, extremities and trauma products.&nbsp;Our surgical products are used to support various surgical
	procedures.&nbsp;Our sports medicine products are primarily for the repair of soft tissue injuries, most commonly used in the knee and shoulder. Our biologics products are used as early intervention for joint preservation or to support surgical
	procedures. Our foot and ankle and extremities products are designed to treat arthritic conditions and fractures in the foot, ankle, shoulder, elbow and wrist. Our trauma products are used to stabilize damaged or broken bones and their surrounding
	tissues to support the body&#146;s natural healing process.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our significant S.E.T. brands include the following:
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="TOP">

	materials, biologics products, implant and instrument designs and surgical techniques remains one of our core strategies and continues to be an important driver of sales growth.

	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="47%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="1">
	ZIMMER BIOMET HOLDINGS, INC.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="1">
	2015 FORM 10-K ANNUAL REPORT
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We are broadening our offerings in each of our product categories and exploring new
	technologies with possible applications in multiple areas.&nbsp;Our primary research and development facility is located in Warsaw, Indiana.&nbsp;We have other research and development personnel based in, among other places, Canada, China, France,
	Switzerland and other U.S. locations.&nbsp;As of December 31, 2015, we employed approximately 1,700&nbsp;research and development employees worldwide.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We expect to continue to identify innovative technologies, which may include acquiring complementary products or businesses, establishing technology licensing arrangements or strategic alliances.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Government Regulation and Compliance
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We are subject to government
	regulation in the countries in which we conduct business. In the U.S., numerous laws and regulations govern all the processes by which medical devices are brought to market. These include, among others, the Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act and
	regulations issued or promulgated thereunder. The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (&#147;FDA&#148;) has enacted regulations that control all aspects of the development, manufacture, advertising, promotion and postmarket surveillance of medical
	products, including medical devices. In addition, the FDA controls the access of products to market through processes designed to ensure that only products that are safe and effective are made available to the public.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Most of our new products fall into an FDA classification that requires the submission of a Premarket Notification (510(k)) to the
	FDA.&nbsp;This process requires us to demonstrate that the device to be marketed is at least as safe and effective as, that is, substantially equivalent to, a legally marketed device.&nbsp;We must submit information that supports our substantial
	equivalency claims.&nbsp;Before we can market the new device, we must receive an order from the FDA finding substantial equivalence and clearing the new device for commercial distribution in the U.S.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Other devices we develop and market are in a category (class) for which the FDA has implemented stringent clinical investigation and
	Premarket Approval (&#147;PMA&#148;) requirements. The PMA process requires us to provide clinical and laboratory data that establishes that the new medical device is safe and effective. The FDA will approve the new device for commercial
	distribution if it determines that the data and information in the PMA application constitute valid scientific evidence and that there is reasonable assurance that the device is safe and effective for its intended use(s).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	All of our devices marketed in the U.S. have been cleared or approved by the FDA, with the exception of some devices which are exempt or
	were in commercial distribution prior to May 28, 1976.&nbsp;The FDA has grandfathered these devices, so new FDA submissions are not required.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Both before and after a product is commercially released, we have ongoing responsibilities under FDA regulations. The FDA reviews design and manufacturing practices, labeling and record keeping, and
	manufacturers&#146; required reports of
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	adverse experiences and other information to identify potential problems with marketed medical devices. We are also subject to periodic inspection by the FDA for compliance with the FDA&#146;s
	Quality System regulations among other FDA requirements, such as restrictions on advertising and promotion. The Quality System regulations govern the methods used in, and the facilities and controls used for, the design, manufacture, packaging and
	servicing of all finished medical devices intended for human use. If the FDA were to conclude that we are not in compliance with applicable laws or regulations, or that any of our medical devices are ineffective or pose an unreasonable health risk,
	the FDA could require us to notify healthcare professionals and others that the devices present unreasonable risks of substantial harm to the public health, order a recall, repair, replacement, or refund payment of such devices, detain or seize
	adulterated or misbranded medical devices, or ban such medical devices.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The FDA may also impose operating restrictions, enjoin
	and/or restrain certain conduct resulting in violations of applicable law pertaining to medical devices, and assess civil or criminal penalties against our officers, employees or us. The FDA may also recommend prosecution to the U.S. Department of
	Justice (&#147;DOJ&#148;).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The FDA, in cooperation with U.S. Customs and Border Protection (&#147;CBP&#148;), administers
	controls over the import of medical devices into the U.S. The CBP imposes its own regulatory requirements on the import of our products, including inspection and possible sanctions for noncompliance. We are also subject to foreign trade controls
	administered by certain U.S. government agencies, including the Bureau of Industry and Security within the Commerce Department and the Office of Foreign Assets Control within the Treasury Department.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	There are also requirements of state, local and foreign governments that we must comply with in the manufacture and marketing of our
	products.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In many of the foreign countries in which we market our products, we are subject to local regulations affecting,
	among other things, design and product standards, packaging requirements and labeling requirements. Many of the regulations applicable to our devices and products in these countries are similar to those of the FDA. The member countries of the
	European Union have adopted the European Medical Device Directive, which creates a single set of medical device regulations for products marketed in all member countries. Compliance with the Medical Device Directive and certification to a quality
	system enable the manufacturer to place a CE mark on its products. To obtain authorization to affix the CE mark to a product, a recognized European Notified Body must assess a manufacturer&#146;s quality systems and the product&#146;s conformity to
	the requirements of the Medical Device Directive. We are subject to inspection by the Notified Bodies for compliance with these requirements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Further, we are subject to various federal, state and foreign laws concerning healthcare fraud and abuse, including false claims and anti-kickback laws, as well as the U.S. Physician Payments Sunshine Act
	and similar state and foreign healthcare professional payment transparency laws.&nbsp;These
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; HEIGHT:0PX; FONT-SIZE:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
	6
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage7"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D112646D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="47%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="1">
	ZIMMER BIOMET HOLDINGS, INC.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="1">
	2015 FORM 10-K ANNUAL REPORT
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	laws are administered by, among others, the U.S. Department of Justice, the Office of Inspector General of the Department of Health and Human Services, state attorneys general and various foreign
	government agencies.&nbsp;Many of these agencies have increased their enforcement activities with respect to medical device manufacturers in recent years. Violations of these laws are punishable by criminal and/or civil sanctions, including, in some
	instances, fines, imprisonment and, within the U.S., exclusion from participation in government healthcare programs, including Medicare, Medicaid and Veterans Administration (&#147;VA&#148;) health programs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our operations in foreign countries are subject to the extraterritorial application of the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act.&nbsp;Our
	global operations are also subject to foreign anti-corruption laws, such as the UK Bribery Act, among others.&nbsp;As part of our global compliance program, we seek to address anti-corruption risks proactively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our facilities and operations are also subject to complex federal, state, local and foreign environmental and occupational safety laws and
	regulations, including those relating to discharges of substances in the air, water and land, the handling, storage and disposal of wastes and the clean-up of properties by pollutants.&nbsp;We do not expect that the ongoing costs of compliance with
	these environmental requirements will have a material impact on our consolidated earnings, capital expenditures or competitive position.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Competition
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The orthopaedics and broader musculoskeletal care industry is highly competitive.&nbsp;In the global markets for our knees, hips, and
	S.E.T. products, our major competitors include: the DePuy Synthes Companies of Johnson &amp; Johnson; Stryker Corporation; and Smith &amp; Nephew plc.&nbsp;There are smaller competitors in these product categories as well who have success by
	focusing on smaller subsegments of the industry.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In the spine and CMF categories, we compete globally primarily with the
	spinal and biologic business of Medtronic, Inc., the DePuy Synthes Companies, Stryker Corporation, NuVasive, Inc. and Globus Medical, Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In the dental implant category, we compete primarily with Nobel Biocare Holding AG (part of the Danaher Corporation), Straumann Holding AG and Dentsply International.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Competition within the industry is primarily based on pricing, technology, innovation, quality, reputation and customer service.&nbsp;A
	key factor in our continuing success in the future will be our ability to develop new products and improve existing products and technologies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Manufacturing and Raw Materials
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We manufacture our products at various sites.&nbsp;We also strategically outsource some manufacturing to qualified suppliers who are
	highly capable of producing components.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The manufacturing operations at our facilities are designed to incorporate the
	cellular concept for production and to implement tenets of a manufacturing philosophy
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	focused on continuous improvement efforts in product quality, lead time reduction and capacity optimization.&nbsp;Our continuous improvement efforts are driven by Lean and Six Sigma
	methodologies.&nbsp;In addition, at certain of our manufacturing facilities, many of the employees are cross-trained to perform a broad array of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We generally target operating our manufacturing facilities at optimal levels of total capacity.&nbsp;We continually evaluate the potential to in-source and outsource production as part of our
	manufacturing strategy to provide value to our stakeholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We have improved our manufacturing processes to protect our profitability and
	offset the impact of inflationary costs.&nbsp;We have, for example, employed computer-assisted robots and multi-axis grinders to precision polish medical devices; automated certain manufacturing and inspection processes, including on-machine
	inspection and process controls; purchased state-of-the-art equipment;&nbsp;in-sourced core products and processes; and negotiated cost reductions from third-party suppliers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We use a diverse and broad range of raw materials in the manufacturing of our products.&nbsp;We purchase all of our raw materials and select components used in manufacturing our products from external
	suppliers.&nbsp;In addition, we purchase some supplies from single sources for reasons of quality assurance, sole source availability, cost effectiveness or constraints resulting from regulatory requirements.&nbsp;We work closely with our suppliers
	to assure continuity of supply while maintaining high quality and reliability.&nbsp;To date, we have not experienced any significant difficulty in locating and obtaining the materials necessary to fulfill our production schedules.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Intellectual Property
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Patents and other proprietary rights are important to the continued success of our business.&nbsp;We also rely upon trade secrets,
	know-how, continuing technological innovation and licensing opportunities to develop and maintain our competitive position.&nbsp;We protect our proprietary rights through a variety of methods, including confidentiality agreements and proprietary
	information agreements with vendors, employees, consultants and others who may have access to proprietary information.&nbsp;We own or control through licensing arrangements approximately 7,000 issued patents and patent applications throughout the
	world that relate to aspects of the technology incorporated in many of our products.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Employees
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As of December 31, 2015, we
	employed approximately 17,500 employees worldwide, including approximately 1,700&nbsp;employees dedicated to research and development.&nbsp;Approximately 8,400 employees are located within the U.S. and approximately 9,100&nbsp;employees are located
	outside of the U.S., primarily throughout Europe and in Japan.&nbsp;We have approximately 7,700 employees dedicated to manufacturing our products worldwide.&nbsp;The Warsaw, Indiana production facilities employ approximately 2,800 employees in the
	aggregate.
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; HEIGHT:0PX; FONT-SIZE:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
	7
</FONT>
</P>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">

</EFX_NAME_AND_TITLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Mr. Dvorak
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	was appointed President, Chief Executive Officer and a member of the Board of Directors in May 2007.&nbsp;He championed Zimmer&#146;s acquisition of Biomet, positioning the combined Zimmer Biomet as a
	global leader in musculoskeletal healthcare. Prior to his appointment as President and Chief Executive Officer, Mr. Dvorak served as Group President, Global Businesses and Chief Legal Officer from December 2005. From October 2003 to December 2005,
	he served as Executive Vice President, Corporate Services, Chief Counsel and Secretary, as well as Chief Compliance Officer. Mr. Dvorak joined the Company (then Zimmer) as Senior Vice President, Corporate Affairs and General Counsel in December
	2001, shortly following the Company&#146;s spin-off from Bristol-Myers Squibb.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Mr.
	Collins
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	was appointed Vice President, Corporate Controller and Chief Accounting Officer effective June 2015.&nbsp;Prior to that, Mr. Collins served as Vice President, Finance for the
	Global Reconstructive Division and Global Operations organization.&nbsp;He joined the Company (then Zimmer) in 2010 as Vice President, Finance for the Global Reconstructive Division and U.S. Commercial organization.&nbsp;Before joining Zimmer, Mr.
	Collins held the position of Vice President, Finance and served as the chief financial officer of the Commercial segment of Oshkosh Corporation from 2007 to 2010.&nbsp;From 1997 to 2007, he was employed at Guidant Corporation and Boston Scientific
	Corporation, where he held a number of positions of increasing responsibility, including Finance Director and chief financial officer of the Guidant Japan organization, Global Director of Operations Finance and Director of Strategic Planning.
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Mr. Florin
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	was appointed Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer effective June 2015.&nbsp;He served as Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of Biomet from June 2007 to June 2015.&nbsp;Prior
	to joining Biomet, Mr. Florin served as Vice President and Corporate Controller of Boston Scientific Corporation from 2001 until 2007.&nbsp;Before being appointed Corporate Controller in 2001, Mr. Florin served in financial leadership positions
	within Boston Scientific Corporation and its various business units.&nbsp;Prior to joining Boston Scientific Corporation, Mr. Florin worked for C.R. Bard from October 1990 through June 1995.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Mr. Johnson
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	was appointed Group President with responsibility for the Company&#146;s
	Spine, Dental, Craniomaxillofacial and Thoracic businesses effective June 2015. He served as Senior Vice President, Biomet, and President, Biomet Microfixation, Bone Healing and Spine from June 2012 to June 2015. Before that, he served as President,
	Biomet Microfixation from 2007 to 2012 and Vice President, Global Marketing, Biomet Microfixation from 2006 to 2007. Prior to that, Mr. Johnson served as Director of Global Marketing for Regeneration Technologies, Inc. (now known as RTI Surgical,
	Inc.). He also worked for Biomet for five years previously, starting his career with Biomet in 1999.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Mr. Kleopfer
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	was appointed President, Americas effective June 2015. He is responsible for the Company&#146;s sales and management of the
	direct and indirect sales channels in the Americas region, including the United States, Canada and Latin America. Mr. Kleopfer served as President, Biomet U.S. from May 2011 to June 2015. Before that, he served as President, Biomet Biologics from
	December 2005 to May 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; HEIGHT:0PX; FONT-SIZE:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>

<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
	8
</FONT>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="1">
	ZIMMER BIOMET HOLDINGS, INC.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Prior to those appointments, Mr. Kleopfer held numerous positions of increasing responsibility within Biomet, where he began his career in 1988.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Dr. Mazur-Hofsaess
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	was appointed
	President, EMEA in April 2013. Dr. Mazur-Hofsaess joined the Company (then Zimmer) in February 2010 as Senior Vice President, EMEA Reconstructive. She has more than 20 years&#146; experience within the pharmaceutical, diagnostics and medical device
	sectors. Prior to joining Zimmer, Dr. Mazur-Hofsaess served in various management positions at Abbott Laboratories beginning in 2001, most recently as Vice President, Diagnostics &#150; Europe.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Mr. Nolan
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	was appointed Group
	President with responsibility for the Company&#146;s Biologics, Extremities, Sports Medicine, Surgical, Trauma, Foot and Ankle and Bone Healing businesses effective June 2015. He joined the Company (then Zimmer) in November 2012 as Senior Vice
	President, Sales. From January 2014 to June 2015, he served as Senior Vice President, Sales and Advanced Solutions. Prior to joining Zimmer, Mr. Nolan served as President, Biomet Sports Medicine, Extremities and Trauma from 2011 to 2012 and as
	President, Biomet Sports Medicine from 2001 to 2011. He joined Biomet in 1996.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Mr.
	Phipps
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	was appointed Senior Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary in May 2007. He has global responsibility for the Company&#146;s Legal Affairs and he serves as Secretary to the
	Board of Directors. Mr. Phipps also oversees the Company&#146;s Government Affairs, Corporate Communication and Public Relations activities. Previously, Mr. Phipps served as Associate General Counsel and Corporate Secretary from December 2005 to May
	2007. He joined the Company (then Zimmer) in September 2003 as Associate Counsel and Assistant Secretary. Prior to joining Zimmer, he served as Vice President and General Counsel of L&amp;N Sales and Marketing, Inc. in Pennsylvania and he practiced
	law with the firm of Morgan, Lewis &amp; Bockius in Philadelphia, focusing on corporate and securities law, mergers and acquisitions and financial transactions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Mr. Williamson
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	was appointed Group President, Joint Reconstruction with
	responsibility for the Company&#146;s Knee, Hip, Bone Cement, Patient-Matched Implants and Personalized Solutions businesses effective June 2015. He served as Senior Vice President, Biomet and President, Global Reconstructive Joints from February
	2014 to June 2015. Prior to that, Mr.&nbsp;Williamson served as Biomet&#146;s Vice President and General Manager, Global Bone Cement and Biomaterials Research from September 2011 to February 2014, and as Corporate Vice President, Global Biologics
	and Biomaterials from May 2006 to September 2011. Mr. Williamson previously served as Biomet&#146;s Vice President, Business Development from December 2003 to May 2006. He began his career with Biomet in 1990 as a Product Development Engineer.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Mr. Yi
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	was appointed
	President, Asia Pacific effective June 2015.&nbsp;He is responsible for the sales, marketing and distribution of products in the Asia Pacific region.&nbsp;Mr. Yi joined the Company (then Zimmer) in March 2013 as Senior Vice President, Asia
	Pacific.&nbsp;Before joining Zimmer, he served as
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Vice President and General Manager of St. Jude Medical for Asia Pacific and Australia from 2005 to 2013.&nbsp;Prior to that, Mr. Yi held several leadership positions over a ten-year period with
	Boston Scientific Corporation, ultimately serving as Vice President for North Asia.
</FONT>
</P>

	www.zimmerbiomet.com or directly at http://investor.zimmerbiomet.com. We use this website as a means of disclosing material, non-public information and for complying with our disclosure obligations under Regulation FD. Accordingly, investors should
	monitor the Investor Relations section of our website, in addition to following our press releases, Securities and Exchange Commission (&#147;SEC&#148;) filings, public conference calls, presentations and webcasts.&nbsp;Our goal is to maintain the
	Investor Relations website as a portal through which investors can easily find or navigate to pertinent information about us, free of charge, including:

	&nbsp;&nbsp;

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="1">
	2015 FORM 10-K ANNUAL REPORT
</FONT>
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_RISK_FACTORS>
<A NAME="FIS_RISK_FACTORS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="85%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="12">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="12" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D112646D10K_HTM_TX112646_3">
</A>
	Item 1A.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Risk Factors
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Risk factors which could cause actual results to differ from our expectations and which could
	negatively impact our financial condition and results of operations are discussed below and elsewhere in this report.&nbsp;Additional risks and uncertainties not presently known to us or that are currently not believed to be significant to our
	business may also affect our actual results and could harm our business, financial condition and results of operations.&nbsp;If any of the risks or uncertainties described below or any additional risks and uncertainties actually occur, our business,
	results of operations and financial condition could be materially and adversely affected.
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Successful integration of
	Biomet and anticipated benefits of the Biomet merger are not assured and integration matters could divert attention of management away from operations.&nbsp;Also, the merger could have an adverse effect on our business relationships.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Although Biomet has become an indirect wholly owned subsidiary of ours, it is initially continuing its operations on a basis that is
	separate from the legacy Zimmer operations. There can be no assurance that Biomet will be able to maintain and grow its business and operations.&nbsp;In addition, the market segments in which Biomet operates may experience declines in demand and/or
	new competitors. Customers, suppliers and other third parties with business relationships with us and/or Biomet may decide not to renew or may decide to seek to terminate, change and/or renegotiate their relationships with us and/or Biomet as a
	result of the merger, whether pursuant to the terms of their existing agreements with us and/or Biomet or otherwise.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our
	ability to realize the anticipated benefits of the Biomet merger will depend, to a large extent, on our ability to integrate the legacy businesses.&nbsp;Integrating and coordinating certain aspects of the operations and personnel of Biomet with ours
	involves complex operational, technological and personnel-related challenges.&nbsp;This process is time-consuming and expensive, disrupts the businesses of both companies and may not result in the full benefits expected by us, including cost
	synergies expected to arise from supply chain efficiencies and overlapping general and administrative functions.&nbsp;The potential difficulties, and resulting costs and delays, include:
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	managing a larger combined company;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	consolidating corporate and administrative infrastructures;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	issues in integrating manufacturing, warehouse and distribution facilities, research and development and sales forces;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	difficulties attracting and retaining key personnel;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	loss of customers and suppliers and inability to attract new customers and suppliers;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	unanticipated issues in integrating information technology, communications and other systems;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	incompatibility of purchasing, logistics, marketing, administration and other systems and processes; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	unforeseen and unexpected liabilities related to the merger or Biomet&#146;s business.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Additionally, the integration of our and Biomet&#146;s operations, products and personnel
	may place a significant burden on management and other internal resources. The attention of our management may be directed towards integration considerations and may be diverted from our day-to-day business operations, and matters related to the
	integration may require commitments of time and resources that could otherwise have been devoted to other opportunities that might have been beneficial to us. The diversion of management&#146;s attention, and any difficulties encountered in the
	transition and integration process, could harm our business, financial condition and operating results.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Even if our businesses
	are successfully integrated, we may not realize the full benefits of the merger, including anticipated synergies, cost savings or growth opportunities, within the expected timeframe or at all.&nbsp;In addition, we expect to incur significant
	integration and restructuring expenses to realize synergies.&nbsp;However, many of the expenses that will be incurred are, by their nature, difficult to estimate accurately.&nbsp;These expenses could, particularly in the near term, exceed the
	savings that we expect to achieve from elimination of duplicative expenses and the realization of economies of scale and cost savings.&nbsp;Although we expect that the realization of efficiencies related to the integration of the businesses may
	offset incremental transaction, merger-related and restructuring costs over time, we cannot give any assurance that this net benefit will be achieved in the near term, or at all.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Any of these matters could adversely affect our businesses or harm our financial condition, results of operations or business prospects.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	We incurred substantial additional indebtedness in connection with the Biomet merger and may not be able to meet all of our
	debt obligations.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:3%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We incurred substantial additional indebtedness in connection with the Biomet merger.&nbsp;At
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, our total indebtedness was $11.6 billion, as compared to $1.4 billion at December&nbsp;31, 2014.&nbsp;We funded the cash portion of the merger consideration, the pay-off of certain indebtedness of Biomet and the payment of
	transaction-related expenses through a combination of available cash-on-hand and proceeds from debt financings, including proceeds from a $7.65 billion issuance of senior unsecured notes in March 2015, and borrowings of $3.0 billion under our $4.35
	billion credit agreement.&nbsp;As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, our debt service obligations, comprised of principal and interest (excluding capital leases and equipment notes), during the next 12 months are expected to be $339.8 million.&nbsp;As a
	result of the increase in our debt, demands on our cash resources have increased.&nbsp;The increased level of debt could, among other things:
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	require us to dedicate a large portion of our cash flow from operations to the servicing and repayment of our debt, thereby reducing funds available
	for working capital, capital expenditures, research and development expenditures and other general corporate requirements;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR:BOTH; HEIGHT:0PX; FONT-SIZE:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW" SIZE="2">
	10
</FONT>
</P>

</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="POSITION:RELATIVE;FLOAT:LEFT; WIDTH:48%;PADDING-RIGHT:1%;PADDING-BOTTOM:8PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;PADDING-TOP:3PT">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
